definition: to enter the venue for a meeting/to enter into an examination/to enter a stadium, arena etc
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: Children under 18 are not admitted to this film.
sentences.chinese: 未满18岁的小孩不得入场看这部电影。

sentences.english: A spectator is admitted by ticket only.
sentences.chinese: 1每一名观众都必须凭票入场。

sentences.english: Because we're students we get in free of charge.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以免费入场，因为我们是学生。

sentences.english: The token entitle you to two free admission to the museum.
sentences.chinese: 凭此券你可以得到两张参观博物馆的免费入场券。

sentences.english: Passes to spectator stand and beer coupons are offered to bona-fide visitors only.
sentences.chinese: 观赏区入场券及啤酒畅饮券只供访港旅客使用。

sentences.english: Eg: a, There were no tickets available for Friday's performance.
sentences.chinese: 星期五演出的入场券搞不到。

sentences.english: With personal business card or related proofs to achieve free passport.
sentences.chinese: 凭个人名片或相关职业证明获取免费入场证。

sentences.english: You have to pay RMB10.0 admission.
sentences.chinese: 你须付10元人民币入场费。

sentences.english: After the entertainment the captain obtained an entrance fee.
sentences.chinese: 娱乐表演之后，船长获得了一笔入场费。

sentences.english: He debarred all those who are not members.
sentences.chinese: 他不让任何一个非会员入场。

sentences.english: The trend is real. I'll invest, but only if the price is right.
sentences.chinese: 看来这波行情是真的，等到价格合适的时候我在入场。

sentences.english: What is the entrance fee for nonmembers?
sentences.chinese: 非会员的入场费要多少呢？

sentences.english: For oversea exhibitors, we will send the Admission Ticket by airmail.
sentences.chinese: 主办单位将会以空邮寄出入场券予海外参展商。

sentences.english: Free admission on a first-come, first-served basis.
sentences.chinese: 免费入场，座位有限，先到先得。

sentences.english: The concert is going to begin, the audience are waiting to enter with their tickets.
sentences.chinese: 演唱会就要开始了，观众们拿着票在等待以次入场。

definition: to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
(of an actor, athlete etc) to prepare to make one's entrance/to wait in the wings
roll-call (e.g. at athletics event)/check the record
to wait and see/to watch from the sidelines/to look around/to survey

to send off (player for a foul)/to knock out (i.e. to beat in a knock-out tournament)/to eliminate/to call out/to kill off/to pull out of (a competition)/to retire (a runner in baseball)/out (i.e. man out in baseball)
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
to do sth in batches or groups
